text: Barvas (Scottish Gaelic: Barabhas or Barbhas) is a settlement, community and civil parish on the Isle of Lewis in Scotland. A photo of Bun-Sgoil Bharabhais Barvas Primary School Rev Allan MacArthur was minister of the Free Church in Barvas 1857 to 1887.Ewing, William Annals of the Free Church It developed around a road junction. The A857 and A858 meet at the southern end of Barvas. North is the road to Ness; west takes the traveller to Carloway and the West Side; south runs the road to Stornoway. According to the 2011 Census it still has the highest concentration of Scottish Gaelic speakers in Scotland (64% of the population) with 2,037. In the early 2000s, controversy hit the area as one of Europe's largest windfarms was planned for Barvas Moor.
